text: The Jerusalem historical town hall is a historical building that used to be the town hall of Jerusalem. It is in Safra Square, next to the walls of the Old City and Jaffa Street. The building was built in 1930 during the time of the British Mandate for Palestine. It was used until 1993, when a new city hall building was opened next to the old one. == Other websites == * photos of the old city hall in allaboutjerusalem site. Category:Buildings and structures in Jerusalem Category:Government buildings in Israel Category:Local government in Israel Category:Town halls
title: Jerusalem Historical City Hall Building
